summary: Phosphorus (symbol P) is a chemical element with atomic number 15. It exists as white or red phosphorus but is rarely found in nature due to its reactivity. Phosphorus is crucial for life, especially in DNA and cell structures. First discovered in 1669, it was isolated from human urine and bone ash. Phosphorus is essential for plants, and most mined phosphorus is used in fertilizers. It's also used in detergents, pesticides, and even nerve agents.
title: Phosphorus
